text.text: How do I access the Trip Counts report?

text: To run the Trip Counts report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Trip Counts by Charge Category. 3. Start and End Date: Pick how far back you want the report to start and the date you want it to end. 4. Click View Report.

text.text: What summary information does the Trip Counts report provide?

text: The top of the Trip Counts report shows a summary of monthly trips listed by level of service. Under the summary, the report lists claim details for each level of service. Page 2 shows the total charges, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances.

text.text: How can I customize the date range for the Trip Counts report?

text: The date range you enter to run the report is based on the claim's date of service. For example, 9/8/2020 to 10/8/2020 would display all claims with the date of service in that date range.

text.text: Can I visualize the data from the Trip Counts report using a Pivot Chart?

text: Yes, you can throw the top of the Trip Counts report into a Pivot Chart to see if you are trending and how many types of trips you are doing.

text.text: What types of details are included in the Trip Counts report?

text:
The Trip Counts report includes the following information::
* Page 1: Shows the counts per charge category per month
* Page 2: Shows the total charges, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances

text.text: Why is it recommended to use the Trip Counts report daily?

text: It is recommended to use the Trip Counts report daily to help identify your projected revenue, trends by LOS or month, and total trips by week/month/quarter/year.

text.text: In what ways can the Trip Counts report help in analyzing trends?

text: The Trip Counts report can help identify your projected revenue, trends by LOS or month, and total trips by week/month/quarter/year. It can also help you track your charges.

text.text: What insights can I gain from the Trip Counts report regarding total trips?

text: The Trip Counts report can help you gain insights into total trips by showing a summary of monthly trips listed by level of service. It also lists claim details for each level of service.

text.text: How does the Trip Counts report contribute to operational planning?

text: The Trip Counts report can help you identify your projected revenue, trends by LOS or month, and total trips by week/month/quarter/year. It can also help you track your charges.

text.text: What information does the Trip Counts by Charge Category report display?

text:
The Trip Counts by Charge Category report displays the following information:

* Page 1: Shows the counts per charge category per month
* Page 2: Shows the total charges, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances

text.text: How do I access the Trip Counts by Charge Category report?

text:
To run the report, you can follow these steps:

1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports
2. Scroll down the list and click Trip Counts by Charge Category

text.text: What details are included on page one of the report?

text:
Page one of the report shows the following information:

* The counts per charge category per month

text.text: Can the Trip Counts by Charge Category report help in tracking charges?

text: Yes, the Trip Counts by Charge Category report can help in tracking charges.

text.text: What insights can I gather from page two of the Trip Counts by Charge Category report?

text:
Page two of the report shows the following information:

* The total charges, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances.

text.text: How does the Trip Counts by Charge Category report assist in financial analysis?

text: The Trip Counts by Charge Category report can be used to help identify your projected revenue, trends by LOS or month, and total trips by week/month/quarter/year.

text.text: What date range options are available for the Trip Counts by Charge Category report?

text: To run the report, you need to select a start and end date. You can also pick how far back you want the report to start and the date you want it to end.

text.text: How frequently should I use the Trip Counts by Charge Category report?

text: The Trip Counts by Charge Category report can be used daily.

text.text: How does this report contribute to optimizing billing processes?

text: The Trip Counts by Charge Category report can be used to track your charges. Page 1 shows the counts per charge category per month. Page 2 shows the total charges, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances.

text.text: Are there any actionable insights derived from the Trip Counts by Charge Category report?

text: The Trip Counts by Charge Category report can be used to help identify your projected revenue, trends by LOS or month, and total trips by week/month/quarter/year.

text.text: What information does the Facility Trip Counts report provide?

text: The Facility Trip Counts report lists all facilities for which you have had trips from or to in the time frame you selected.

text.text: How do I access the Facility Trip Counts report?

text: To run the report: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Facility Trip Counts. 3. Start and End Date: Pick how far back you want the report to start and the date you want it to end. 4. Click View Report.

text.text: How does the Facility Trip Counts report help in facility management?

text: The Facility Trip report can be used to identify which facilities you pick-up from and drop-off to the most.

text.text: What insights can I gain from the Facility Trip Counts report?

text: The Facility Trip Counts report can help you identify which facilities you pick-up from and drop-off to the most.

text.text: How can the Facility Trip Counts report contribute to improving operational efficiency?

text: The Facility Trip Counts report can help you identify which facilities you pick-up from and drop-off to the most. This information can help you improve operational efficiency by identifying which facilities you need to focus on.

text.text: What date range options are available for the Facility Trip Counts report?

text: The date range you enter to run the report is based on the claim's date of service. For example, 9/8/2020 to 10/8/2020 would display all claims with the date of service in that date range.

text.text: How frequently should I use the Facility Trip Counts report?

text: The Facility Trip Counts report is recommended to be used monthly.

text.text: In what ways does this report facilitate decision-making regarding facility usage?

text: The Facility Trip Counts report can help you identify which facilities you pick-up from and drop-off to the most. This information can help you improve operational efficiency by identifying which facilities you need to focus on.

text.text: Are there any actionable insights derived from the Facility Trip Counts report?

text: The Facility Trip Counts report can help you identify which facilities you pick-up from and drop-off to the most. This information can help you improve operational efficiency by identifying which facilities you need to focus on.

text.text: What is the purpose of the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report is used to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed. This report shows the following information: • How the claim was created - manually or imported • The PRID number • Run or incident number • How the claim was imported and from where • The claim number • Service date • Claim status • Patient first and last name • The destination facility name.

text.text: How do I access the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: To access the Trip Reconciliation report, you need to run this report in ZOLL Billing and then run a equivalent report in your patient care system using the same time period. You can compare the two to verify that all exported PCRs are being addressed within ZOLL Billing.

text.text: What information does the Trip Reconciliation report display?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report shows the following information: • How the claim was created - manually or imported • The PRID number • Run or incident number • How the claim was imported and from where • The claim number • Service date • Claim status • Patient first and last name • The destination facility name.

text.text: How does the Trip Reconciliation report assist in reconciling trips?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report shows cases that were manually created and imported within a specific time period. Recommended use Use the Trip Reconciliation report every week to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: Can I track the origin of claims using the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: Yes, the Trip Reconciliation report shows the following information: • How the claim was created - manually or imported • The PRID number • Run or incident number • How the claim was imported and from where • The claim number • Service date • Claim status • Patient first and last name • The destination facility name.

text.text: What details are included in the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report shows the following information: • How the claim was created - manually or imported • The PRID number • Run or incident number • How the claim was imported and from where • The claim number • Service date • Claim status • Patient first and last name • The destination facility name.

text.text: How does this report contribute to ensuring data accuracy?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report is used to reconcile trips imported into ZOLL Billing. It can be used to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: What date range options are available for the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: The date range you enter to run the report is based on the claim's date of service. For example, 9/8/2020 to 10/8/2020 would display all claims with the date of service in that date range.

text.text: How frequently should I use the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: Use the Trip Reconciliation report every week to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system.

text.text: Are there any actionable insights derived from the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: The report shows the following information: How the claim was created, PRID number, Run or incident number, How the claim was imported and from where, The claim number, Service date, Claim status, Patient first and last name, The destination facility name.

text: The top of the Trip Counts report shows a summary of monthly trips listed by level of service. Under the summary, the report lists claim details for each level of service. Page 2 shows the total charges, including mileage, date of service, claim number, claim status, charges, and balances.
